snippet: Supporters say the move will improve stability, but opponents warn that it will entrench the governing party’s control over the former Soviet state.
abstract: Majority of Armenians vote to increase prime minister's powers in preliminary referendum; opponents criticize proposed changes to Constitution, claiming that they are intended as preparation for end of Pres Serzh Sargsyan's term in 2018, at which point he will assume prime minister position.
lead_paragraph: Supporters say the move will improve stability, but opponents warn that it will entrench the governing party’s control over the former Soviet state.

headline.main: Armenia: Referendum Approves Broader Powers for Prime Minister
headline.print_headline: Europe; Armenia: Referendum Approves Broader Powers for Prime Minister
